Follow These Steps: 
 
 - Stand behind the person and slightly to one side. 
 
 - Support their chest with one hand 
 
 - Lean the person forward so that the object blocking will come out of their mouth 
 
 - Give up to five sharp blows between the person's shoulder blades with the heel of your hand 
 
 - Check if the blockage has cleared 
 
 - If not, give Heimlich 
 
 - Stand behind the person and place your arms around their waist and bend them forward 
 
 - Clench one fist and place it fight above their belly button 
 
 - Put the other hand on top of your fist and pull sharply inwards and upwards 
 
 - Repeat for 5 times 
 
 - If still blocked, make sure to call Emergency Services 
 
 - Keep repeating cycles of five back blows and 5 abdominal thrusts while waiting for Emergency Services

Follow These Steps: 
 
 - Make sure they are hydrated -- stop drinking alcohol immediately and drink water 
 
 - Don't move them from their current position 
 
 - Lay them on their side so they do not throw up in their mouth and choke 
 
 - Keep them warm with jackets and/or blankets 
 
 - Accompany them at all times even when they are asleep to monitor breathing 
 
 - If they are having trouble breathing or is unconscious call Emergency Services immediately 
 
 - Tip: Most universities do not penalize students for alcohol emergencies

Follow These Steps: 
 
 - Call 911 and elect someone to retrieve an AED 
 
 - Lie the person on their back , tilt the head back slightly to lift the chin 
 
 - Check for breathing for no more than 10 seconds, if no breathing proceed with CPR 
 
 - Place your hands, one on top of th other in the middle of the chest 
 
 - Push down at least 2 inches deep and at a rate of 100 compressions per minute 
 
 - Deliver rescue breaths. With the person's head tilted slightly back and chin lifted, 
 
 - Pinch the nose shut and place your mouth over the person's mouth to make a complete seal 
 
 - Blow into the person's mouth to make the chest rise 
 
 - Continue with cycles of compressions and rescue breaths until person exhibits signs of life, an AED becomes available, or EMS arrives

Follow These Steps: 
 
 - Call Emergency Services 
 
 - Protect the person from injury 
 
 - If they are on the ground, try to position them to the side 
 
 - Wait for Emergency Services to arrive 
 
 - Seizures typically last 60 - 90 seconds 
 
 - DO NOT apply too much pressure to their body 
 
 - DO NOT force anything or try to hold them down 
 
 - DO NOT offer anything to eat or drink until they are fully aware
